revised_title: A Detailed Account of the 1758 Lingfield and Edenbridge Earthquake
tldr: In January 1758, an earthquake was felt in Lingfield, Surrey, and Edenbridge, Kent. James Burrow investigated the event and confirmed that it was indeed an earthquake, despite it not causing any damage. He interviewed several residents who experienced the shaking and described the event as brief and not accompanied by a loud noise in most cases.
